markdown:
The club's membership structure includes various categories with specific initiation fees, transfer scenarios, age requirements, and special provisions. Members are required to attend a New Member Orientation within two weeks of payment receipt unless waived by the Board [Doc:1#Chunk:1]. Transfer scenarios include foundation transfers to children with a transfer fee equal to the current Foundation Membership initiation fee plus taxes [Doc:1#Chunk:1]. Surviving spouses of Foundation, Golfing Senior, Social, or Social Former Foundation Members can request transfer to surviving spouse status upon the death of the member [Doc:1#Chunk:1].

I. MEMBERSHIP CATEGORIES & INITIATION FEES
- New members must attend an orientation within two weeks of payment receipt [Doc:1#Chunk:1].

II. TRANSFER FEES & SCENARIOS
- Foundation transfers to children require a transfer fee equal to the current Foundation Membership initiation fee plus taxes [Doc:1#Chunk:1].
- Surviving spouses of specific member categories can request transfer to surviving spouse status upon the member's death [Doc:1#Chunk:1].

III. REINSTATEMENT PROVISIONS
- Not specified in the provided notes.

IV. PAYMENT & BILLING REQUIREMENTS
- New members must pay initiation fees to activate their membership [Doc:1#Chunk:1].

V. AGE-BASED PROVISIONS & RESTRICTIONS
- Not specified in the provided notes.

VI. SPECIAL PROGRAMS & PROVISIONS
- Surviving spouses of certain member categories can request transfer to surviving spouse status upon the member's death [Doc:1#Chunk:1].

VII. ADDITIONAL FEES & REQUIREMENTS
- Not specified in the provided notes.
